channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Poorly repaired previously reported, 29th May
item.description:
Clearly GCC do not have any idea of the state of roads and are not able to make judgements whilst on site. Some potholes were repaired at this location yesterday (28/5) and this was either missed or your system of identification and schedule of repair is an entire nonscience and waste of our tax payers money. An explanation would be appreciated 07527 114235

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Bramble Chase, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes within potholes!, 28th May
item.description:
Greenhills Road, massive collection of potholes which have joined forces. Weirdly you painted around a small inner section of it, weeks ago. Nothing has still been done and sooner or later it will cause vehicular damage and also accidents, as motorists swerve to avoid driving through it. There are several others in this road, however this is by far the worst. It has been like this for months
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, Greenhills Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Lansdown Crescent, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This tree is blocking late afternoon sunlight to our garden to be able to use our pool. It’s also blocking light to our hedge, so has killed a large area of this. We’ve tried regrowing two conifers to fill the gap but they don’t get enough light to survive & we now have a large gab in our hedge on the Old Bath Road side. We don’t want this tree to get any bigger, causing more damage to our hedge & further blocking the sunshine into our garden, 28th May
item.description:
Opposite 155A Old Bath Road, Cheltenham front of property

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, The Avenue, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: After removal of hedge, uneven paving slabs exposed outside No 3?, 28th May
item.description:
The overhanging hedge at no 3 (I think), opposite the dental surgery) has been removed in the last couple of weeks, which has exposed the uneven paving slabs in the public footpath. There is a difference in height of about 3cm between some slabs. The contractor who removed the hedge stated that he did not use any heavy machinery on the public side.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Painswick Road, Tivoli, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Diseased branches falling on pavement, 28th May
item.description:
Opposite 41 Montpellier Terrace - this tree sustained damage a couple of years ago and now some branches are dead and falling on to the pavement. This area is frequently used by families off-loading their children from their cars in order to go to the park.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Back Montpellier Terrace, Montpellier, Cheltenham

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 28th May
item.description:
Customer reports large tree at location has several dead branches, is concerned that these may fall off and injure children waiting at the school bus stop below. Customer states that they are happy to allow an inspector into their property to look into the tree from an upstairs window.
Report on FixMyStreet
